I have fixed all the test cases except this one.The problem with this one is that it behave differently for http1 and http2
For http1
We get two HAProxyDecoder Exception
io.netty.handler.codec.haproxy.HAProxyProtocolException: io.netty.handler.codec.haproxy.HAProxyProtocolException: unknown identifier: GET
io.netty.handler.codec.haproxy.HAProxyProtocolException: io.netty.handler.codec.haproxy.HAProxyProtocolException: unknown identifier: host:

And for http2
We get one HAProxyDecoder Exception
io.netty.handler.codec.haproxy.HAProxyProtocolException: header length (over 269) exceeds the allowed maximum (108)

And one from SSLHandler
java.nio.channels.ClosedChannelException

So if using waitFor(2) assuming 1 is from complete of client  the other should countdown when exception instanceof HAProxyProtocolException
The we will have 3 countdowns for http1 and two countdowns for http2
How do you suggest we should handle this problem?
Split the test between http1 / http2 ?
